result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Almon Anderson

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant Robert Almon Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Robert Almon Anderson.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF308 and 22CF349. Court notes motion was previously filed and he has reviewed the motion. Attorney Nelsen notes the motion filed. Defendant does not have lengthy criminal history. Defendant is a lifelong resident with strong family times. Asks that the cash bail be modified in 22CF349, asks for it to be modified to around $1,000. Notes defendant would like to seek out an assessment and inpatient treatment. Notes that defendant has made attempts to join sobriety group. Notes that the jail time served thus far has been a wake up call.
Court notes the hearing is being live streamed at the request of the victim. State objects to modification of cash bond. Notes severity of the offenses and notes the defendant has same victim in both files and was out on a signature bond when he was charged with the second file. Court notes bond is meant to assure court appearances. State finds no prior convictions. Attorney Nelsen acknowledges State's concerns over victim's safety. Attorney Nelsen notes that the defendant has no intentions of contacting victim but has been focused on seeking treatment.
Court notes bail is meant to assure appearances in court but notes the conditions of signature bond were violated. 
Court denies the motion for bail modification; bail set is appropriate. 
Parties asks for a status in about 30 day. Parties predict they are close to a resolution.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:07 AM Defendant Robert Almon Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Robert Almon Anderson.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen has received information in 22CF308 and in 22CF349, pleads not guilty and requests status conference. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Court notes bail modification hearing next week. Attorney Nelsen asks for a status conference to be set next week at bail hearing.
Defendant's notice of motion and motion for reduction of bail
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

9:29 AM Defendant Robert Almon Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Robert Almon Anderson.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Jared Rankila sworn and testifies. Officer for SPD. Relates incident. Spoke to victim. 
State calls Noah DePuma sworn and testifies. Officer for SPD. Relates responding to address. Witness identifies defendant. 
State provides Exhibit #1 Bond form from 22CF308 (M_O_R)
State rests
Att Nelsen no witnesses
State moves for bind over
Att Nelsenmakes statement
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets date
Arraignment scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:27 PM Defendant Robert A Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen appeared by video for Robert A Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received complaint, waives reading and asks for preliminary hearing. State requests $2,000 cash bail and condition of no contact with Victim #1. Defendant is currently out on bond with same victim. Attorney Nelsen states defendant may be going to treatment and therefore, asks for a signature bond. Court orders $2,000 cash bail with condition of no contact with Victim #1.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
